sentences.en: Brute force was used to put down the revolt.
sentences.cn: 使用残忍的武力平息反叛.

sentences.en: Children always revolt against parental disciplines.
sentences.cn: 孩子们总是反抗父母的管束.

sentences.en: He was revolted by the smell.
sentences.cn: 那气味让他恶心。

sentences.en: I did a story on the condominium dweller's revolt at Golden sands.
sentences.cn: 我曾写了一篇文章论及金沙公寓居住者们的反感.

sentences.en: In the East the progressive revolt had a more decidedly urban complexion.
sentences.cn: 在东部,进步派的反叛带有更明显的城市色彩.

sentences.en: It was feared that the army would revolt against the government.
sentences.cn: 有人担心军队会挥戈反对政府。

sentences.en: Our whole hearts revolt against the way women have hitherto been treated.
sentences.cn: 我们对妇女迄今所受的待遇从心底里感到厌恶.

sentences.en: Rumors of a revolt were afloat.
sentences.cn: 叛变的谣言四起.

sentences.en: She revolved the'son Willoughby " through moods of stupefaction, contempt, revolt, subjection.
sentences.cn: 她以麻木 、 鄙夷 、 厌恶 、 屈从的心情反复默想着 “ 我的孩子威洛比 ”.

sentences.en: She turned away in revolt from the nasty old man.
sentences.cn: 她对那下流的老头感到恶心,便转过脸去.

sentences.en: Some members of the government may revolt against this proposed legislation.
sentences.cn: 一些政府成员可能会反对这项拟议中的法规。

sentences.en: Some members of the government may revolt against this proposed legislation.3
sentences.cn: 一些政府成员可能会反对这项拟议中的法规。

sentences.en: Soon the entire armed forces were in open revolt.
sentences.cn: 很快，整个武装部队开始公然抗命。

sentences.en: Teenagers often revolt against parental discipline.
sentences.cn: 青少年常常不遵从父母的条条框框。

sentences.en: The leader of the revolt made an unconditional surrender early this morning.
sentences.cn: 今天上午早些时候，反叛的首领无条件投降。

sentences.en: The peasants threatened to revolt.
sentences.cn: 农民威胁说要造反。

sentences.en: The people living underneath the tyranny rose in open revolt.
sentences.cn: 生活在暴政下的人民公开反叛了.

sentences.en: the Polish revolt of 1863
sentences.cn: 1863年的波兰起义

sentences.en: The press has often reported that I led a revolt against Knudsen.
sentences.cn: 新闻界经常报道说,我带头反抗努森.

sentences.en: The prime minister is now facing a revolt by members of his own party.
sentences.cn: 首相现在面临着党内倒戈。

sentences.en: The tribesmen will revolt if you ask them to pay taxes.
sentences.cn: 你若要求部落里的人们交税,他们会反叛的.

sentences.en: This is seen as a reward for the army's loyalty during a barracks revolt earlier this month.
sentences.cn: 此举被视为是对在本月初一场军营叛变中表现忠心不贰的军队的奖赏。

words.tran_cn: 背叛地；讨厌地；令人恶心地
反叛，造反；起反感（revolt的现在分词形式）

trans.tran_en: strong and often violent action by a lot of people against their ruler or government

trans.tran_cn: 反叛，起义；反抗，违抗；厌恶，生反感
trans.tran_en: if people revolt, they take strong and often violent action against the government, usually with the aim of taking power away from them
a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
